group_1.textCenter: (This is the site where the Daybreak Ceremony@will be held...)
(I saw this place in my dream as well.)

group_1.textRight: Hello, Shizuka. What is it that you want?

group_1.textLeft: ...There's something I'd like to ask you...@It regards two Diviners of yore.
Do you remember two girls named@Hatsu and Suwe?

group_1.textRight: Yes, of course I remember them.

group_1.textLeft: Is it true that Miss Suwe made a wish for@"a Calamity-Calling Cup?"

group_1.textRight: There is no doubt that the cup in question...

group_1.textLeft: Then...
Did Miss Hatsu make a wish to counter@Miss Suwe's?

group_1.textRight: I can't tell you what her intentions were,@but to use her words,
"I wish for a sword to drive away the power@of the Calamity-Calling Cup."
The result is the sword that you use@in your rituals.

group_1.textLeft: Oh god...
So in the end, just as Mikoshiba had planned,
their wishes were used to form the ritual...
Is that it...?
...[wait:1.0][chara:102501:cheek_0][chara:102501:face_mtn_ex_050.exp.json][chara:102501:lipSynch_1]Oh? Wait...that's strange.
If Hatsu's wish came true,
why hasn't the cup been rendered useless?

group_1.textRight: Part of the sword was broken away,@so it cannot be used to its full potential.

group_1.textLeft: How could that possibly...?
Do you mean Mikoshiba took it@away from Miss Hatsu...?

group_1.textRight: Since the sword has lost part of its power@and is weakened,
it can therefore touch the cup and drive away@the calamities without breaking the cup itself.
This is why the Daybreak Ceremony was established,@and held once every few years.
It seems that part of the sword,@the part that was removed,
was used to sense when disaster was@about to strike.

group_1.textLeft: Oh no...this is awful...

group_1.textRight: If you can return the removed part and restore@the sword, it should regain its true power.

group_1.textLeft: But we didn't find anything like that in@Mikoshiba's belongings...
Do you know where it is?

group_1.textRight: I do not know where it is now, either.

group_1.textLeft: (To go through the trouble of weakening the@sword's power and using it for herself...)
(I don't know how it was done,)
(but a Mikoshiba would be capable...)
(Miss Suwe, who was exploited...)
(Miss Hatsu, who never got her chance...)
(It's not right...)
(All I can do for the two of them,@as a descendant of the Tokime Clan, is...)
(But that would be...breaking tradition...)

group_1.textCenter: So I think we should acknowledge that anxiety,@face it,
and figure out how to overcome it.

group_1.narration: Miss Suwe, who was deceived,@and Miss Hatsu, who tried to save her...
To honor these former Diviners,@I mustn't continue the ritual.

group_1.textCenter: ...is destroy the Calamity-Calling Cup and@break this tradition forever!
